One could start the simulations in 1929 to estimate the role of monetary developments in causing the depression. While this procedure is not strictlycorrect because some of the monetary developments in the early l930s wereclearly endogenous, the results confirm the conventional wisdom: monetaryforces had little effect during the onset of the Great Depression in 1929 and1930, but were the crucial cause of the deepening of the depression in 1931and 1932.
